intro: Gardenia schoemannii, commonly known as the Malabar gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and large, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers are not only aesthetically pleasing but also attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
